summary: The Made in America Motors Act proposes to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow individuals to deduct interest paid on qualified motor vehicle interest. This deduction is capped at $2,500 and applies to interest on loans for vehicles manufactured and assembled in the United States, effective for tax years beginning after December 31, 2025. The bill defines “qualified motor vehicle” and provides details on what constitutes final assembly for eligibility.
